items.title: how to use my own  templates by Django-bootstrap3
items.body: I have my own template, which contains CSS, JS, Image, HTML and other files. How to use Django-Bootstrap3 to quickly build

items.title: Distinguish between errors and help text
items.body: You should be able to distinguish between errors and help texts. Now they are all rendered by one template.

items.title: Fix simple typo: attrivute -> attribute
items.body:
There is a small typo in src/bootstrap3/templatetags/bootstrap3.py.
Should read `attribute` rather than `attrivute`.

items.title: Version is missing
items.body:
Since the switch to `setuptools_scm`, `bootstrap3.__version__` is missing.

This was an undocumented feature, but it would be good to have it back.

See also: https://github.com/dyve/django-bootstrap3/issues/468

items.title: v12.0.0 removes bootstrap3.__version__
items.body:
The `__version__` attribute has been removed in 12.0.0 from the bootstrap3 module.
This is backwards incompatible and results in errors for apps using the version info.
Tested with 12.0.0 on Linux:
```
Python 3.7.3 (default, Apr  3 2019, 05:39:12)
[GCC 8.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import bootstrap3
>>> bootstrap3.__version__
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'bootstrap3' has no attribute '__version__'
```

11.1.0 works fine:
```
Python 3.7.3 (default, Apr  3 2019, 05:39:12)
[GCC 8.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import bootstrap3
>>> bootstrap3.__version__
'11.1.0'
```

items.title: #453 actually breaks checkboxes
items.body:
Image of form with checkbox: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1nNlAnZbnhMLbnzRh4xvrBFL6YG40YD30 template code: ```
{% csrf_token %} {% bootstrap_form form layout="horizontal" horizontal_field_class="col-sm-6" horizontal_label_class="col-sm-3" %} {% if redirect_field_value %} {% endif %}
```

items.title: bootstrap_button has no apparent way to manually set the "disabled" attribute
items.body:
i have searched the docs and google high and low and i have tried various combinations and have found nothing that allows me to set the disabled attribute when creating a button with bootstrap_button.

```
{% bootstrap_button "Test" button_type="button" icon="earphone" button_class="btn-primary btn-sm" %}
```

if there is a way to do this the docs could really use an update, thanks.

items.title: Python 3 - Solution error: Function "url_to_attrs_dict" expects a string or a dict with key "url".
items.body:
#Fix bootstrap.py
Please correct the file!

def get_bootstrap_setting(setting, default=None):
    """
    Read a setting
    """
    value = BOOTSTRAP3.get(setting, default)
    return value if value else BOOTSTRAP3_DEFAULTS.get(setting)

items.title: [Minor]CSS conflicted with admin page
Drop support for Python 2.7, 3.4, 3.5, Django 1.11 and Django 2.0
items.body:
The next major version of `django-bootstrap3` will only support Python >= 3.6 and Django >= 2.1.

If you are running any of these versions you should pin `django-bootstrap3<12`.

items.title: DeprecationWarning with Python 3.7
items.body:
When using django-bootstrap3 with Python 3.7 with warnings enabled, the following deprecation warning is emitted:

```
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/bootstrap3/utils.py:5: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import Mapping
```

It would be good if django-bootstrap3 was warning-free on Python 3.7. (In our specific case, this warning pollutes our test suite output.)

### Steps to reproduce

```console
$ python3.7 --version
Python 3.7.1
$ python3.7 -m pip install django django-bootstrap
[...]
$ python3.7 -Wall -c 'import bootstrap3.utils'
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/bootstrap3/utils.py:5: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import Mapping
```

items.title: BUG: renders charfield wrong with django-summernote
items.body:
When using [django-summernote](https://github.com/summernote/django-summernote) the rendering doesn't work appropriately. Both fields are rendered on top of each other, and the css doesn't handle margins correctly. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9048078/56353378-83df0100-61d1-11e9-811b-f775cca07049.png)

summernote version: '0.8.8.8'
bootstrap3 version: ''11.0.0'

items.title: Add renderer argument to `Widget.render()` to support Django 2.1
items.body:
Support for Widget.render() methods without the renderer argument [was removed in Django 2.1](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1).

Bootstrap3 templates in 2.1 error with `render() got an unexpected keyword argument 'renderer'`, but render as expected in 2.0.9.

No module named 'django.core.urlresolvers'
items.body: django2.X changed django.core.urlresolvers replace by  django.urls, cause ImportError

items.title: "addon_before, label_class and field_class" also don't work with checkbox.
items.body:
It can be solved when adding "label_class=self.get_label_class()" to the function below
```
def put_inside_label(self, html):
        content = '{field} {label}'.format(
            field=html,
            label=self.label,
        )
        return render_label(
            content=mark_safe(content),
            label_for=self.field.id_for_label,
            label_title=escape(strip_tags(self.field_help)),
            label_class=self.get_label_class()
        )
```

This function is located in "bootstrap3/renderers.py"

items.title: Support only Django 1.11 and 2.0 with supported Python versions
items.body:
Support only:

- Django 1.11 with Python 2.7, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.11/)
- Django 2.0 with Python 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/2.0/)

items.title: Allow {% bootstrap_field exclude argument to be a list.
items.body:
I have a form with basic / advanced fields. I have a list of advanced field names defined on the form and a property returning all the basic field names, so I can render the fields like so:

```
{% bootstrap_form form exclude=form.advanced_fieldnames %}
{% bootstrap_form form exclude=form.basic_fieldnames %}
```

However, the exclude parameter must be a comma separated string of field names, and passing a list of field names makes it complain: `'list' object has no attribute 'replace'`.

I currently use `{% bootstrap_form form exclude=form.basic_fieldnames|join:',' %}` as a workaround, but it would be nice if that was not required.

items.body: **my main url is:** `url(r'^posts/', include("posts.urls", namespace="posts")),` **my app url is:** `url(r'^(?P\d+)/update/$', PostUpdateView.as_view(), name='update'),` i am trying to access it in my template like this: ` ***` **and getting this error:** NoReverseMatch at / Reverse for 'update' with no arguments not found. 1 pattern(s) tried: ['posts/(?P\\d+)/update/$']

items.title: Consider some rewritings
items.body:
```diff
diff --git a/bootstrap3/bootstrap.py b/bootstrap3/bootstrap.py
--- a/bootstrap3/bootstrap.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/bootstrap.py
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@ def javascript_url():
     Return the full url to the Bootstrap JavaScript file
     """
     url = get_bootstrap_setting('javascript_url')
-    return url if url else bootstrap_url('js/bootstrap.min.js')
+    return url or bootstrap_url('js/bootstrap.min.js')
 
 
 def css_url():
@@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ def css_url():
     Return the full url to the Bootstrap CSS file
     """
     url = get_bootstrap_setting('css_url')
-    return url if url else bootstrap_url('css/bootstrap.min.css')
+    return url or bootstrap_url('css/bootstrap.min.css')
 
 
 def theme_url():
diff --git a/bootstrap3/components.py b/bootstrap3/components.py
--- a/bootstrap3/components.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/components.py
@@ -29,8 +29,7 @@ def render_alert(content, alert_type=None, dismissable=True):
     Render a Bootstrap alert
     """
     button = ''
-    if not alert_type:
-        alert_type = 'info'
+    alert_type = alert_type or 'info'
     css_classes = ['alert', 'alert-' + text_value(alert_type)]
     if dismissable:
         css_classes.append('alert-dismissable')
diff --git a/bootstrap3/forms.py b/bootstrap3/forms.py
--- a/bootstrap3/forms.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/forms.py
@@ -140,12 +140,9 @@ def render_field_and_label(
     Render a field with its label
     """
     if layout == 'horizontal':
-        if not label_class:
-            label_class = get_bootstrap_setting('horizontal_label_class')
-        if not field_class:
-            field_class = get_bootstrap_setting('horizontal_field_class')
-        if not label:
-            label = mark_safe(' ')
+        label_class = label_class or get_bootstrap_setting('horizontal_label_class')
+        field_class = field_class or get_bootstrap_setting('horizontal_field_class')
+        label = label or mark_safe(' ')
         label_class = add_css_class(label_class, 'control-label')
     html = field
     if field_class:
@@ -175,9 +175,7 @@ def is_widget_required_attribute(widget):
         return False
     if not widget.is_required:
         return False
-    if isinstance(widget, WIDGETS_NO_REQUIRED):
-        return False
-    return True
+    return not isinstance(widget, WIDGETS_NO_REQUIRED)
 
 
 def is_widget_with_placeholder(widget):
diff --git a/bootstrap3/renderers.py b/bootstrap3/renderers.py
--- a/bootstrap3/renderers.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/renderers.py
@@ -266,8 +266,7 @@ class FieldRenderer(BaseRenderer):
         else:
             # Or just set it to empty
             self.placeholder = ''
-        if self.placeholder:
-            self.placeholder = text_value(mark_safe(self.placeholder))
+        self.placeholder = self.placeholder and text_value(mark_safe(self.placeholder))
 
         self.addon_before = kwargs.get('addon_before', self.widget.attrs.pop('addon_before', ''))
         self.addon_after = kwargs.get('addon_after', self.widget.attrs.pop('addon_after', ''))
diff --git a/bootstrap3/templatetags/bootstrap3.py b/bootstrap3/templatetags/bootstrap3.py
--- a/bootstrap3/templatetags/bootstrap3.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/templatetags/bootstrap3.py
@@ -49,14 +49,11 @@ def bootstrap_message_classes(message):
     """
     Return the message classes for a message
     """
-    extra_tags = None
     try:
         extra_tags = message.extra_tags
     except AttributeError:
-        pass
-    if not extra_tags:
-        extra_tags = ""
-    classes = [extra_tags]
+        extra_tags = None
+    classes = [extra_tags or '']
     try:
         level = message.level
     except AttributeError:
@@ -869,12 +866,9 @@ def get_pagination_context(page, pages_to_show=11,
         )
     num_pages = page.paginator.num_pages
     current_page = page.number
-    half_page_num = int(floor(pages_to_show / 2))
-    if half_page_num < 0:
-        half_page_num = 0
+    half_page_num = max(0, int(floor(pages_to_show / 2)))
     first_page = current_page - half_page_num
-    if first_page <= 1:
-        first_page = 1
+    first_page = max(first_page, 1)
     if first_page > 1:
         pages_back = first_page - half_page_num
         if pages_back < 1:
@@ -914,11 +913,8 @@ def get_pagination_context(page, pages_to_show=11,
             url += '?'
             # Append extra string to url
     if extra:
-        if not url:
-            url = '?'
-        url += force_text(extra) + '&'
-    if url:
-        url = url.replace('?&', '?')
+        url = (url or '?') + force_text(extra) + '&'
+    url = url and url.replace('?&', '?')
     # Set CSS classes, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#pagination
     pagination_css_classes = ['pagination']
     if size == 'small':
diff --git a/bootstrap3/tests.py b/bootstrap3/tests.py
--- a/bootstrap3/tests.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/tests.py
@@ -134,8 +134,7 @@ def render_template(text, context=None):
     Create a template ``text``
     """
     template = engines['django'].from_string(text)
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     return template.render(context)
 
 
@@ -143,8 +142,7 @@ def render_template_with_bootstrap(text, context=None):
     """
     Create a template ``text`` that first loads bootstrap3.
     """
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     return render_template("{% load bootstrap3 %}" + text, context)
 
 @@ -152,8 +150,7 @@ def render_template_with_form(text, context=None):
     """
     Create a template ``text`` that first loads bootstrap3.
     """
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     if 'form' not in context:
         context['form'] = TestForm()
     return render_template_with_bootstrap(text, context)
@@ -163,8 +160,7 @@ def render_formset(formset=None, context=None):
     """
     Create a template that renders a formset
     """
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     context['formset'] = formset
     return render_template_with_form('{% bootstrap_formset formset %}', context)
 
@@ -173,8 +169,7 @@ def render_form(form=None, context=None):
     """
     Create a template that renders a form
     """
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     if form:
         context['form'] = form
     return render_template_with_form('{% bootstrap_form form %}', context)
@@ -192,8 +187,7 @@ def render_field(field, context=None):
     """
     Create a template that renders a field
     """
-    if not context:
-        context = {}
+    context = context or {}
     context['field'] = field
     return render_template_with_form('{% bootstrap_field field %}', context)
 
```

items.title: field_class and label_class not copied from widget
items.body:
Hi,

great work, before all. Thanks.

I'm trying to put only on some rows of the form 2 char fields (ie. name / surname), the other rows has only one field. To do this, I need for some fields to change the value of field_class and form_class.

My code for the form is something like:
```
<form method="post">
	{% csrf_token %}
	{% bootstrap_form form %}
	<input type="submit" value="submit"/>
</form>
```
The CharField is created as:
`self.fields['name'] = forms.CharField(label = mark_safe(label), 
                                                widget=forms.Widget(attrs={'field_class': 'col-md-5'}))`

Is this a bug or a feature? If it's a feature, how can I specify only for some fields a custom field_class?

thanks in advance
BG

items.title: Error: Parameter "form" should contain a valid Django Form
Skip a call to len()
items.body:
The call to len() is unnecessary, since `if len(x):` is equivalent to `if x;`.  Moreover, looping over an empty sequence doesn't do anything.

```diff
diff --git a/bootstrap3/utils.py b/bootstrap3/utils.py
--- a/bootstrap3/utils.py
+++ b/bootstrap3/utils.py
@@ -63,17 +63,16 @@ def parse_token_contents(parser, token):
     if len(bits) >= 2 and bits[-2] == 'as':
         asvar = bits[-1]
         bits = bits[:-2]
-    if len(bits):
-        for bit in bits:
-            match = kwarg_re.match(bit)
-            if not match:
-                raise TemplateSyntaxError(
-                    'Malformed arguments to tag "{}"'.format(tag))
-            name, value = match.groups()
-            if name:
-                kwargs[name] = parser.compile_filter(value)
-            else:
-                args.append(parser.compile_filter(value))
+    for bit in bits:
+        match = kwarg_re.match(bit)
+        if not match:
+            raise TemplateSyntaxError(
+                'Malformed arguments to tag "{}"'.format(tag))
+        name, value = match.groups()
+        if name:
+            kwargs[name] = parser.compile_filter(value)
+        else:
+            args.append(parser.compile_filter(value))
     return {
         'tag': tag,
         'args': args,
```

items.title: Placeholder for Email Input Fields Does Not Show
items.body:
In the template,
```{% bootstrap_field form.email_address placeholder='abc@example.com' %}```,
where `form.email_address` is an `EmailField`, the `placeholder` attribute is not added to the `input` element.

items.title: Bootstrap 4
items.body:
With the release of Bootstrap v4.0.0-beta it raises the question whether the this project in the future will fork to a version for Bootstrap 4 (which seems already what https://github.com/bitkits/bootstrap4-django set out to do, with little work done however), or try work on supporting both versions.

Can someone elaborate on what to expect, and maybe update the readme with at statement regarding the matter?

items.title: Form widget DateField, but input is type="text"
items.body:
In the class view have a model with field "nacimiento" (aka "birth"). In method get_form i check if this field is a form.DateField, and yes! it's. But in template, {% bootstrap_form %} print a input with type="text": ``` form = super(ClienteUpdate, self).get_form(form_class=form_class) print(form.fields['nacimiento']) ``` In template: `
` bootstrap3 version: django-bootstrap3==9.0.0

items.title: Label generated with show_label=False with checkbox
items.body:
{% bootstrap_field form.statut       form_group_class='col-md-6'  show_label=False  %}
The form.statut field is a checkbox
Html Result : 
<div class="col-md-6">
    <div class="checkbox">
                    <label for="id_statut">
        <input name="statut" class="" required="" id="id_statut"  type="checkbox"> J'adhère aux 
        <a href="url_statuts.pdf" target="_blank">statuts</a>
                    </label>
          </div>
</div>



show_label has no effect. The source of the issue is maybe: 
FieldRenderer.put_inside_label()  in post_widget_render() with CheckBoxInput (renderers.py)

items.title: Features : Date / Time / DateTime Fields in Django can be render in Bootstrap DateTime pickers + has-feedback icons
items.body:
Hello

Can you implements DateTime fields with https://eonasdan.github.io/bootstrap-datetimepicker/
You can add configuration option to enable / disable this feature because it's not in Bootstrap but it's an addon.

And just add  `.has-feedback` and icons option that we can enable in `BOOTSTRAP3` http://getbootstrap.com/css/#callout-has-feedback-icon-accessibility

Exemple : http://i.imgur.com/c4gKE8t.png

Great continuation for your project ;)

items.body:
I got the error from a django page using django-bootstrap3, it seems that the only 'open' tag is the one specifying the CSS.  Closing the 'link' tag fixes the error, and the page is displayed correctly.

Is it possible (via configuration file or code fix) to change the  close the link tag from:  

`<link href="//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">`
to:
`<link href="//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet" />`

Thanks

Alessandro

items.title: Bootstrap ChoiceField not compatible in internet explorer browsers
items.body: When an option is selected in a choice field, the field not show the selected option

items.title: labels generated with bootstrap_form template tag does not have title attribute populated from model field's help_text
items.body:
When using the `bootstrap_form` template tag, the generated label element does not get its title attribute populated from the `help_text` attribute of the corresponding model field. Whereas, it does work as expected for the `bootstrap_label` template tag.

This seems to be because the call to `render_label` inside the `add_label` method of the `FieldRenderer` class in `renderers.py` does not include a `label_title` parameter. Using the working call to `render_label` as guidance, filling out the parameter like so seems to do the trick:

`label_title=escape(strip_tags(self.field_help))`

items.title: Demo app error: cannot find admin template widgets
items.body:
When running the demo app and accessing e.g. http://localhost:8000/form there is an error:

```
TemplateDoesNotExist at /form
admin/widgets/split_datetime.html
```

Adding `django.contrib.admin` to the `INSTALLED_APPS` of the demo project solved the issue.  This is using Django 1.11.1 with Python 2.7.

items.title: unable to apply filters to bootstrap_messages
items.body:
According to documentation:

> bootstrap3/messages.html
> 
> This renders the Django messages variable.
> 
> Variable messages contains the messages as described in https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/contrib/messages/#displaying-messages
> 
> messages is passed through three built-in filters
> 
> safe <https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#std:templatefilter-safe>
> 
> urlize <https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#std:templatefilter-urlize>
> 
> linebreaksbr <https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#std:templatefilter-linebreaksbr>
> 

bootstrap messages is supposed to be automatically applying the safe, urlize, and linebreaksbr filters but this does not seem to be happening.  Creating a message of the format
`messages.success(request, 'Test message line 1\nTest message line 2')`
should produce a linebreak in the HTML via the linebreaksbr filter but it does not.

items.title: Define "Selected"
items.body:
Is it possible to define the selected field when using `bootstrap_field` that's an option field?

Example would be if I had a Django form of cars:
```
cars_options = (
    ('volvo', 'Volvo'),
    ('saab', 'Saab'),
    ('vw', 'VW'),
    ('audi', 'Audi'),
)

class CarsForm(forms.Form):
    car_type = forms.ChoiceField(required=True, choices=cars_options)
```

I understand I can do `initial='saab'` however I would like to be able to define that on the response. For example, return the information about the car and retain the user's selection.
```
    return render(request, 'cars_app/cars.html', {'form': form,
                                                  'car': selected_car,
                                                  'car_stats': car_stats})
```

So, I would like to be able to render it something similar to this (either the previous selection or None):

```
{% bootstrap_field form.car_type selected={{ car }}|None %}
```

HTML version of what I'm attempting to accomplish.

```
<select>
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
  <option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="vw">VW</option>
  <option value="audi" selected>Audi</option>
</select>
```

Please let me know if you need any additional info. Appreciate any assistance you can provide.

bumped into this one while writing a test case, to check the behaviour of placeholders

items.title: Placeholder not added with Django 1.11
items.body:
I've just stumbled into it locally, so not had chance to investigate.

Basically, with Django 1.11, the placeholders aren't being added to the output.

We rely on the default behaviour of adding the placeholder from the label.

A basic version of our usecase:

```python
# forms.py

class SomeForm(forms.Form):
    some_field = forms.IntegerField(label="This is the label", help_text="this field is for things")
```

```html
# page.html
{% load bootstrap3 %}

{% bootstrap_field some_form.some_field show_help=False %}
```

I'll investigate further in a bit, and probably write a fix.

output of what I had (the top one is just a text field):
![pasted image at 2017_04_06 12_49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2099618/24753609/bcf0b204-1aca-11e7-9f3a-38d7c2651303.png)

It would be nice if I could do `{% bootstrap_form form errors_type='non_fields' %}` and/or set the default behaviour in settings.

items.title: add custom vars to input field
items.body:
I use ``bootstrap-select`` which allow to set a select button style as 
```
<select class="selectpicker" data-style="btn-primary">
```
https://silviomoreto.github.io/bootstrap-select/examples/#button-classes


How to add a custom var to input field, as ``data-style="btn-primary"`` ?

Here my ``forms.py``
```
class CustomForm(forms.Form):
    fold_name = forms.ModelChoiceField(queryset = folds, to_field_name = "foldname", initial = "nofold")
```

Here the template part
```
{% csrf_token %}
{% bootstrap_form_errors custom_form %}
{% bootstrap_field custom_form.fold_name layout="inline" field_class="selectpicker"%}
```

items.title: Feature request: data attributes to bootstrap_button.
items.body:
It would be nice to be able to give bootstrap_button data attributes, so it can be used with JavaScript.

Example 1:
`{% bootstrap_button _('Button text') button_type='button' button_class='pull-right' data-attr1='Hello' data-attr2='World' %}`

Example 2:
`{% bootstrap_button _('Button text') button_type='button' button_class='pull-right' data='{"attr1": "Hello", "attr2": "World"}' %}`

items.title: import SelectDateWidget error
items.body:
**problem**
working with both git versions of django (2.0.dev20170222001300) and django-bootstrap3 (branch dev commit 465e61570453d7633a4bb122b22ee5334ad378d8) I encountered this error:


```
    django-bootstrap3/bootstrap3/renderers.py", line 14, in <module>
    from django.forms.extras import SelectDateWidget
    ImportError: No module named 'django.forms.extras'

```

**Solution**

SelectDateWidget is now in django.forms.widgets so editing renderers.py would work for me:

```
#from django.forms.extras import SelectDateWidget
from django.forms.widgets import SelectDateWidget
```

items.title: Import error for flatatt using upcoming Django 1.11
items.body:
In utils.py and components.py there is an import for flatatt as:
from django.forms.widgets import flatatt

but https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.10/_modules/django/forms/widgets/ says it should be:
from django.forms.utils import flatatt

I tested and the import error goes away if you change it to that. This is on Django 1.11. Perhaps the import using widgets was a redundancy of utils for backward compatibility? I mean it is in the 1.10 docs using utils.

Am I doing something wrong? Or is this an expected limitation from django-bootstrap3? Or perhaps a genuine bug?

Thanks!

items.title: Not working without enabled contettypes
items.body:
I am trying to use django-bootstrap3 on a web project for which I disabled the database in django completely.
If I try to use one of the templatetags, I get an error saying:

> RuntimeError 
> Model class django.contrib.contenttypes.models.ContentType doesn't declare an explicit app_label and isn't in an application in INSTALLED_APPS.

In the stack trace I can see, that this is due to the line
`from django.contrib.auth.forms import ReadOnlyPasswordHashWidget`
in renderers.py, which imports 
`from django.contrib.auth.models import User`
which in term imports
`from django.contrib.contenttypes.models import ContentType`
which throws this error.

It seems like the `ReadOnlyPasswordHashWidget` is only used to check for this field as it has to be handled specially. If the database is disabled, the `django.contrib.auth` cannot be used and therefore this widget is also not used. 

I'm not sure how the correct way of handling this would be, but I'll give it a try.

items.title: Django 1.9 and disabled form fields
items.body:
Note that Django 1.9+ can handle HTML `disabled` attribute.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/el/1.10/ref/forms/fields/#disabled
See #337 for HTML `required` in Django 1.10+.

I suggest removing both `set_required` and `set_disabled` and leave the setting of HTML attributes to Django.

items.title: Pre-filled form results in errors even when valid
items.body:
When I render a form that has some fields already filled in, bootstrap renders these fields and at least one more as containing errors. However the form is valid, as I can submit it successfully as is. The form I'm adding to the context looks something like this, where both fields are foreign keys:

```
form = SomeForm({'user': user, 'query': query})
```

The foreign keys get 'Select a valid choice. That choice is not one of the available choices.' whereas another CharField with choices gets 'This field is required.' But as mentioned these all have valid values.

I'm on Django 1.10.

items.title: Django 1.10 and required form fields
items.body:
Django 1.10 introduces a native way  to add the `required` attribute to form fields:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/es/1.10/ref/forms/api/#django.forms.Form.use_required_attribute

This breaks a few tests involving our `set_required` parameter.

Basically, this means that Django can handle the settings of the `required` attribute through settings in forms, fields, and widgets.

This means that `django-bootstrap3` can either:
1. remove support for settings and overriding the `required` attribute
2. rewrite renderers for `required` it so that they complement Django>=1.10

I'm all for letting Django handle the Django stuff, so I'd favor option 1.

Feedback more than welcome.

items.title: documentation error bootstrap_label
items.body:
It looks like the "for" in the bootstrap_label example should be "label_for"
i.e.
`{% bootstrap_label "Email address" for="exampleInputEmail1" %}`
should be
`{% bootstrap_label "Email address" label_for="exampleInputEmail1" %}`

http://django-bootstrap3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/templatetags.html#bootstrap3.templatetags.bootstrap3.bootstrap_label

items.title: bootstrap_alert
items.body:
When I used the bootstrap_alert. Using default or set " dismissable=True " there is a close icon but it did't work. 
so, I resolved this issue.
Oh,this problem also show with info with forms.ValidationError.

items.title: Pagination - current page
items.body:
When using bootstrap-pagination - active page link to "#" - and when you click on that number of the page - your window goes to the top. ```
  • 1
    • ```

items.title: Import SelectDateWidget from django.forms.widgets instead
items.body:
There is a RemovedInDjango20Warning:

```
bootstrap3/renderers.py:9: RemovedInDjango20Warning: django.forms.extras is deprecated. You can find SelectDateWidget in django.forms.widgets instead.
  from django.forms.extras import SelectDateWidget
```

Looks easily fixable by using `from django.forms.widgets import SelectDateWidget` instead.

items.title: global set_required=False overwrites local set_required=True
items.body:
because of this line: https://github.com/dyve/django-bootstrap3/blob/ae460aa6bc23bb49e8b6b85e12617983a9c162f1/bootstrap3/forms.py#L167 there is no chance to set `set_required` to `True` on single forms/fields if the global setting is `False`. I would expect the global setting to set a default which can be overridden locally.

I'd make a pull request if you can confirm this is not intended behavior.

items.title: django-filter parameters not passed to n+1 pages
items.body: when using bootstrap_pagination in the html, additional parameters, like used by django-filter, aren't passed on the links for n+1 pages.

items.title: Issues with loading bootstrap_css and bootstrap_javascript
items.body: The application is causing isssues when loading the bootstrap_css on the template. The Quick setup mentioned on the doc fail when loading any other tag than bootstrap3. Saying that no such tag exist. Is there something that needs to  be declared somewhere else?

items.title: Issues calling bootstrap3
items.body:
